Instruction: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Heat the oil in a skillet over medium heat. Sear the pork chops for approximately 5 minutes on each side. Take the chops out of the skillet and drain the oil.

Combine the tomatoes, corn, kidney beans, rice, chilies, and salt in the skillet. Bring the mixture to a boil. Cook and stir for 1 minute until everything is heated through. Pour the tomato mixture into a baking dish and place the browned pork chops on top.

Bake covered for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove the cover and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until the rice is tender and the pork has attained an internal temperature of 145 degrees F (63 degrees C).
